oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Curly Putman Interviewed by Bob Allen in 1979
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is of Bob Allen interviewing Curly Putman. The recording takes place on 08-20-79.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Curly Putman
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Side One - (0:00) -- Bob Allen begins interview by asking Curly Putman about his home office. (0:39) -- Curly Putman mentions that he has been co-writing songs with friends as of late. (1:28) -- Curly Putman discusses his own company that he had in conjunction with Tree Publishing Company, "Green Grass Music." (2:38) -- Bob Allen asks Curly Putman how many writers he had signed when he returned to Tree Publishing Company. (4:47) -- Curly Putman discusses how long he was in charge of the writers at Tree Publishing Company. (5:16) -- Bob Allen asks Curly Putman when he first joined Tree Publishing Company. (5:59) -- Curly Putman discusses working with Buddy Killen and Roger Miller. (6:51) -- Bob Allen asks about the size of Tree Publishing Company when Curly Putman joined. (9:09) -- Bob Allen asks Curly Putman how he began writing music. (11:30) -- Bob Allen asks Curly Putman about his relationship with Buddy Killen. Curly Putman mentions that he met Buddy Killen through Roger Miller. (12:50) -- Bob Allen asks Curly Putman about his transition from a song plugger to a full-time songwriter. (15:06) -- Curly Putman discusses working with Bobby Braddock and Sonny Throckmorton. (19:48) -- Curly Putman discusses his own success that happened at 32 years old. (20:48) -- Curly Putman mentions writing "Green, Green Grass Of Home" and "My Elusive Dreams." (22:10) -- Curly Putman describes getting "Green, Green Grass Of Home" first recorded. Tom Jones recorded one of the most successful versions of the song. (23:45) -- Bob Allen asks Curly Putman whether he could live off of his two most successful hits.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Putman, Curly;
